body: Makes sense. Would you like to submit a PR?

issue.title: Refactoring comment docs of `Application`.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
#10947

After:
![screenshot from 2016-02-24 14 06 25](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5828252/13278345/6e12bece-db02-11e5-8253-5f7b98886e65.png)

body: @cebe I guess you need to check it.

looks like a bug in Netbeans as it does not understand that the method will return two different types of classes... We use this pattern in a lot of places. A fix would need to duplicate the methods in web and console application. Not sure if it is worth it. How fast is Netbeans in fixing reported issues?

The proposed PR adds `@property` tags. This is not enough as these would get removed because not corresponding getters/setters exist. I suggest to use an approach like https://github.com/samdark/yii2-cookbook/blob/master/book/ide-autocompletion.md to fix this on application side and report an issue on Netbeans.
Since there's nothing that could be done framework-side, closing it.

> Why we need getter/setter must exist?

because `@property` tags for IDE are auto generated based on getter/setters using this command: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/build/controllers/PhpDocController.php#L32-L42

> If we realy need getter/setter for @property tags, then we must move getRequest() from base application to both console application and web application.

if it would be only Request component, we could easily do that, but this issue affects more components like ErrorHanlder, Response, View, ...

> if it would be only Request component, we could easily do that, but this issue affects more components like ErrorHanlder, Response, View, ...

Then we must move all of that properties.

See **yii2 class reference site**, go to [`yii-web-application.html`](http://www.yiiframework.com/doc-2.0/yii-web-application.html) and look `$request` property. Is that documentation correct?
![screenshot from 2016-02-25 21 36 34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5828252/13322850/14587f10-dc09-11e5-8b3b-fa68b479bfd4.png)

Does it mean `yii\web\Application::$request` can have tipe `yii\console\Request`?
